creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Donald Winston
medium: Oil on paper attached to linen
text: The silence of the figure, with two fingers pressed to the mouth, is not an anxious depiction of repression. Rather, Redon’s interest in silence is intended to emphasize the thoughtfulness of one’s inner world. Here, reflection and thoughtfulness are posed as the protection of the mind above the use of the senses.
title: Silence
